channel.title: Fonts & Gradient Background
channel.description:
[size=15pt][b][u]Fonts: [/u][/b][/size] I'm sure this is a stupid question that could be easily found on google, but I don't know what to search for.
I want to have an article written in "Futura Lt" on a web page. So how to I import this font and what do I use? (CSS, HTML, Javascript)
I'm sure you can't just write "Futura Lt" in tags instead of a font like Arial because some people may not have it. So... do people need to have it downloaded automatically or will it be done server side in say a Font family.
Might be confusing but hopefully you get what I'm saying. Help please ;).
[size=15pt][b][u]Gradient Background: [/u][/b][/size] Okay say my web page is 1024X650 and i have a background which is a gradient, when people who have a larger vertical screen that 650 (virtually everyone) i can only have the background as one colour. Replacing the background with a very large gradient image would increase loading time so I was wondering is there was a way to just have a gradient background that is W:100% H:100%
